com.acrolinx.javasdk.api.extraction

Interface DocumentsFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DocumentsFactoryImpl

    public interface DocumentsFactory
    A factory for creating Documents.

      • createSegmentationDefinitionBuilder

        SegmentationDefinitionBuilder createSegmentationDefinitionBuilder(SegmentationDefinition.InclusionMode defaultInclusion)
        Parameters:
        defaultInclusion - the default inclusion
        Returns:
        A new SegmentationDefinitionBuilder used by stream documents to segment the stream.

      • createSegmentationDefinitionFromFile

        SegmentationDefinition createSegmentationDefinitionFromFile(File file)
                                                            throws IOException
        Parameters:
        file - the file
        Returns:
        the segmentation definition
        Throws:
        IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.

      • createStringDocument

        StringDocumentBuilder createStringDocument(String content)
        Takes a string and creates a Document that you can check with Acrolinx Server. This is the most simple way of checking some plain text. If you have to segment the text you shall have a look at the BlockDocument class.
        Parameters:
        content - is the content of the document.
        Returns:
        the document builder

      • createXmlDocumentFromStream

        DocumentBuilder<?,Document> createXmlDocumentFromStream(InputStream xmlStream,
                                                      SegmentationDefinition extractorConfiguration)
                                                        throws IOException
        Creates an XML document to use with CheckAdapter.check(com.acrolinx.javasdk.api.checksettings.CheckSettings, CheckInformation, com.acrolinx.javasdk.api.checksettings.DocumentCheckSettings) . Make sure that the given InputStream contains valid XML. If the given XML is invalid you will get a SdkRuntimeException when starting the check or calling Document.getText().
        Throws:
        IOException

      • createXmlDocumentFromFile

        DocumentBuilder<?,Document> createXmlDocumentFromFile(File xmlFile,
                                                    SegmentationDefinition extractorConfiguration)
                                                      throws IOException
        Creates an XML document to use with CheckAdapter.check(com.acrolinx.javasdk.api.checksettings.CheckSettings, CheckInformation, com.acrolinx.javasdk.api.checksettings.DocumentCheckSettings) .
        Throws:
        IOException

      • createBlockDocumentBuilder

        <PositionInDocument> BlockDocumentBuilder<PositionInDocument> createBlockDocumentBuilder()
        Creates a new BlockDocumentBuilder. A BlockDocument is an easy way to implement client side segmentation and back mapping chunks of text back to positions in original documents.
        Type Parameters:
        PositionInDocument - The position in the original document. This may be the XML-node in XML-documents or the offset in plain text documents.
        Returns:
        The BlockDocumentBuilder to build a BlockDocument.

      • createBlockBuilder

        <PositionInDocument> BlockBuilder<PositionInDocument> createBlockBuilder()
        Type Parameters:
        PositionInDocument - The position in the original document. This may be the XML-node in XML-documents or the offset in plain text documents.
        Returns:
        A new BlockBuilder used to build a Block.

      • copyBlock

        <PositionInDocument> BlockBuilder<PositionInDocument> copyBlock(Block<PositionInDocument> forCopy)
        Copies a Block.
        Type Parameters:
        PositionInDocument - The position in the original document. This may be the XML-node in XML-documents or the offset in plain text documents.
        Parameters:
        forCopy - The Block to copy.
        Returns:
        The BlockBuilder initialized by the Block to copy.

      • createBlockContext

        BlockContext createBlockContext(String contextName,
                              int nestingDepth)
        Creates a new BlockContext.
        Parameters:
        contextName - The name of the context. For example: The font name, the text style, the XML-Node
        nestingDepth - the nesting depth of a context. It is used by hierarchical context structures like in XML.
        Returns:
        The new BlockContext.

      • createBlockContext

        BlockContext createBlockContext(String contextName,
                              int nestingDepth,
                              Map<String,String> attributes)
        Creates a new BlockContext.
        Parameters:
        contextName - The name of the context. For example: The font name, the text style, the XML-Node
        nestingDepth - the nesting depth of a context. It is used by hierarchical context structures like in XML.
        attributes - the attributes of the context
        Returns:
        The new BlockContext.

      • createLaTexDocument

        DocumentBuilder<?,BlockDocument<Integer>> createLaTexDocument(String laTex)
        Warning:This Document type is experimental and not supported by Acrolinx.
        Parameters:
        laTex - The LaTex document as String
        Returns:
        A DocumentBuilder segmented by LaTex commands.

      • createJavaDocument

        DocumentBuilder<?,BlockDocument<Integer>> createJavaDocument(String javaContent)
        Warning:This Document type is experimental and not supported by Acrolinx.
        Parameters:
        javaContent - The full content of a java file as String
        Returns:
        A DocumentBuilder segmented with java comments extracted.

      • NULL

        Document NULL()
        Returns:
        An empty document.
